title: Pieces of Eight: Still Best Friends After All These Years
features: Essays written by the Maggio siblings: Rosalie, Frank, Patrick, Kevin, Mary, Paul, Mark, and Matthew.
description: We are progressives, conservatives, Catholics, Unitarians, AA, New Agers, chiefs, and Indians. We are unmarried, divorced, and married. We are ectomorphs, mesomorphs, and endomorphs. We parent seventeen children. We are renters, homeowners, and land barons. We are a tribe of many truths. And we're crazy about each other.

The eight Maggio siblings are what the world would call "professionals" (2 lawyers, 2 dentists, 1 business executive, 1 writer, 1 professor/farmer, and 1 actor/director/entrepreneur). They have jobs, they pay bills, they contribute to their communities. But the best thing about them is that they love a good story, especially a
